metadata.synopsis: All questions available to the player when speaking to LZ directly

81.speaker: Lae'zel
81.text: You have finally earned your silver sword. How do you feel?
81.context: NodeContext: Arrogance-- 'why are you bothering me?'

145.speaker: Player
145.text: You have finally earned your silver sword. How do you feel?
145.context: NodeContext: Thrilled about having retrieved a silver sword

446.speaker: Lae'zel
446.context: NodeContext: Thrilled about having retrieved a silver sword

364.speaker: Player
364.text: Well, you've finally got your hands on a silver sword. How does it feel?

573.speaker: Player
573.text: We've retrieved a silver sword, the sort worthy of a gith warrior.

468.speaker: Player
468.text: We've got the Orphic Hammer in hand. What are your intentions?

220.speaker: Player
220.text: Voss has gone underground. He'll be waiting for us there.

117.speaker: Player
117.text: We have the Orphic Hammer. Now what?

385.speaker: Player
385.text: How should we proceed regarding Raphael?

187.speaker: Player
187.text: This Orphic Hammer could be a way to release Orpheus from his prison.

579.speaker: Player
579.text: We should talk about Vlaakith's visit to camp.

111.speaker: Player
111.text: What do you make of that note that Voss carried?

585.speaker: Lae'zel
585.text: His contact in Baldur's Gate holds the means of releasing the one in the Prism, the means of the Githyanki Empire's destruction.

502.speaker: Lae'zel
502.text: I will find out who this contact is. And I will destroy them and their key.

598.speaker: Player
598.text: Tell Lae'zel about what happened inside the artefact.

404.speaker: Player
404.text: Tell Lae'zel what the dream figure said inside the artefact.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: Vlaakith promised to make you Baht t'Vlaakith. What does that mean?

236.speaker: Lae'zel
236.text: Vlaakith's left hand, and her right - commander of all dragons, Chosen of the Queen Regent.

628.speaker: Lae'zel
628.text: Not since Vlaakith-One has a Baht t'Vlaakith been anointed.

311.speaker: Lae'zel
311.text: Another empty promise. Only a naive fool would believe otherwise. The kind of fool I was not so long ago.

19.speaker: Lae'zel
19.text: Once Orpheus is slain, I will take my place in Castle Susurrus as Baht t'Vlaakith the second.

627.speaker: Lae'zel
627.text: Every githyanki, and every red dragon, shall know me by the name.

620.speaker: Player
620.text: Vlaakith promised to make you Baht t'Vlaakith. An incredible honour.

296.speaker: Lae'zel
296.text: Lae'zel of the recent past might have thought so.

171.speaker: Lae'zel
171.text: What young githyanki mightn't dream of becoming commander of all dragons, Chosen of the Queen Regent?

535.speaker: Lae'zel
535.text: So it is. Vlaakith's left hand, and her right - commander of all dragons, Chosen of the Queen Regent.

455.speaker: Player
455.text: A githyanki prince was bound inside the artefact this entire time. I can hardly believe it.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: I'd like to talk about Orpheus.

644.speaker: Player
644.text: I'd like to talk about Orpheus.

463.speaker: Player
463.text: I'd like to talk about Orpheus.

285.speaker: Player
285.text: I'd like to talk about Orpheus.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: Any idea who Voss could be meeting in Baldur's Gate?

193.speaker: Lae'zel
193.text: Only that they have the means to let the Prism's occupant loose -

408.speaker: Lae'zel
408.text: - and thus the means to end Vlaakith's reign and weaken the empire.

74.speaker: Lae'zel
74.text: A ghaik? A githzerai, one of Zerthimon's separatists?

327.speaker: Lae'zel
327.text: Of one thing, I'm most certain: I will kill them as I killed Voss, and Vlaakith will gift me with unspoiled silver.

576.speaker: Player
576.text: Voss seemed to think Vlaakith is a tyrant.

417.speaker: Lae'zel
417.text: A tyrant cracks her whip and eradicates the weak for her own advance.

540.speaker: Lae'zel
540.text: Queen Vlaakith does so to prevent ghaik insurgence.

467.speaker: Lae'zel
467.text: The githyanki are the bulwark preventing illithid advance across the sixteen planes. One crack, and the bulwark collapses.

116.speaker: Lae'zel
116.text: The Undying Queen is ruthless because she has to be. Thanks to her, we endure. All of us.

386.speaker: Lae'zel
386.text: I'd never thought Vlaakith a tyrant, or me as a vassal. She was the source of my might, and I the envoy of her will.

261.speaker: Lae'zel
261.text: A warrior. A champion. A destroyer.

120.speaker: Lae'zel
120.text: But if Voss is right, and Vlaakith consumes the ascended to gain power...

378.speaker: Lae'zel
378.text: Then I am no destroyer. I am mere livestock, bred to be harvested and devoured.

128.speaker: Lae'zel
128.text: Every githyanki is a slave with a singular purpose. Not to cull the ghaik, not to prevent their Grand Design -

186.speaker: Lae'zel
186.text: - but to raise Vlaakith to true godhood.

437.speaker: Player
437.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, not vehement, but confident. She is affirming her belief. (In another version of these same words, she is not confident)

136.speaker: Lae'zel
136.text: Ascension is a young githyanki's greatest honour.
136.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, not vehement, but confident. She is affirming her belief. (In another version of these same words, she is not confident)

50.speaker: Lae'zel
50.text: Long ago, the ghaik enslaved my people. They dominated our minds and bred us for war, until great Mother Gith took a hammer to our bonds.
50.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, not vehement, but confident. She is affirming her belief. (In another version of these same words, she is not confident)

414.speaker: Lae'zel
414.text: From the day of our hatching, young gith have one purpose: to train hard enough to slay a ghaik and take its head.
414.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, not vehement, but confident. She is affirming her belief. (In another version of these same words, she is not confident)

369.speaker: Lae'zel
369.text: Then we speak the Rite of Ascension, and a red dragon comes to fly us to Vlaakith in Tu'narath, City of Death.
369.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, not vehement, but confident. She is affirming her belief. (In another version of these same words, she is not confident)

105.speaker: Lae'zel
105.text: We are honoured with an eternal home in the Astral, celebrated for our victory. We are ascended.
105.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, not vehement, but confident. She is affirming her belief. (In another version of these same words, she is not confident)

134.speaker: Player
134.text: What is ascension supposed to entail?

482.speaker: Lae'zel
482.text: Ascension is a young githyanki's greatest honour.

330.speaker: Lae'zel
330.text: Long ago, the ghaik enslaved my people. They dominated our minds and bred us for war, until great Mother Gith took a hammer to our bonds.

189.speaker: Lae'zel
189.text: From the day of our hatching, young gith have one purpose: to train hard enough to slay a ghaik and take its head.

590.speaker: Lae'zel
590.text: Then we speak the Rite of Ascension, and a red dragon comes to fly us to Vlaakith in Tu'narath, City of Death.

339.speaker: Lae'zel
339.text: We are honoured with an eternal home in the Astral, celebrated for our victory. We are ascended. Or so I believed.

562.speaker: Player
562.text: Crèche Y'llek is destroyed. I doubt there were survivors.

176.speaker: Player
176.text: Your own queen appears to have turned against you. That can't bode well for any of us.

275.speaker: Player
275.text: We met Vlaakith, but left without following her orders. This can't bode well for us.

484.speaker: Player
484.text: So much for 'purification' - the zaith'isk is ruined.

221.speaker: Player
221.text: I'm glad to see you safe out of Orin's grasp.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: A hatchery with a single egg. How many does a clutch usually contain?

351.speaker: Lae'zel
351.text: 'Dispiriting' is a strong word. 'Unusual'? Most certainly.

125.speaker: Lae'zel
125.text: K'liir's clutch held three dozen eggs, more or less, though I've learned of crèches that harboured a hundred.

325.speaker: Lae'zel
325.text: I have never learned, however, of a varsh obsessed with a late egg's survival.

301.speaker: Player
301.text: I know of the egg-layers - the shu'kyani - but I've never seen one for myself.

657.speaker: Lae'zel
657.text: Nor have I. They come to the Material Plane just long enough to pass their eggs.

374.speaker: Lae'zel
374.text: They must, of course - the eggs could never mature in the Astral Plane, where time barely passes.

197.speaker: Lae'zel
197.text: It is a great honour to be chosen as shu'kyani.

297.speaker: Lae'zel
297.text: One that I hope is never bestowed on me.

239.speaker: Player
239.text: I've often wondered how we evolved to lay eggs.

16.speaker: Lae'zel
16.text: Indeed? Perhaps you might have paid more mind to your teacher.

394.speaker: Player
394.text: Githyanki look quite humanoid. How did you evolve to lay eggs?

507.speaker: Lae'zel
507.text: 'Humanoid'. How I despise the term. Githyanki are quite superior to humans.

543.speaker: Lae'zel
543.text: Though it must be said: you are an uncommonly adequate member of your species.

121.speaker: Lae'zel
121.text: Our biology slates state that githyanki came to lay eggs after we escaped illithid enslavement and took to the Astral Plane.

340.speaker: Lae'zel
340.text: It's an asexual process - a favourable change, by any estimation.

119.speaker: Lae'zel
119.text: Hideous, to imagine a life where I couldn't partake in the pleasures of sex without the looming threat of bearing children.

588.speaker: Player
588.text: Who does the laying? I'm curious about the logistics.

513.speaker: Lae'zel
513.text: Shu'kyani. Githyanki chosen by Vlaakith herself to bear young.

617.speaker: Lae'zel
617.text: The queen assigns when and where they must lay, and how many eggs they must bear.

372.speaker: Lae'zel
372.text: The shu'kyani pass their eggs in the Material Plane. In the Astral, time barely passes.

338.speaker: Lae'zel
338.text: It is a meticulous process, carefully timed so that the eggs hatch at once.

286.speaker: Player
286.text: The crèche training room was - illuminating. Are gith instructors always so brutal?

478.speaker: Lae'zel
478.text: He would never have deigned to threaten a youngling. A waste of time and energy.

162.speaker: Lae'zel
162.text: My own sa'varsh would never have threatened a youngling. A waste of time and energy.

608.speaker: Lae'zel
608.text: The pupils themselves culled the weak from their ranks.

201.speaker: Lae'zel
201.text: I myself felled four of my own classmates once K'liir had a hundred times circled Toril.

336.speaker: Player
336.text: That's awful. Is life not precious to the githyanki?
336.context: NodeContext: je-QUITH deh-VEN-zear - The systematic removal of the weak

69.speaker: Lae'zel
69.context: NodeContext: je-QUITH deh-VEN-zear - The systematic removal of the weak

45.speaker: Lae'zel
45.text: Their lives were not precious. They were a blight that required expunging.
45.context: NodeContext: je-QUITH deh-VEN-zear - The systematic removal of the weak

646.speaker: Lae'zel
646.text: The githyanki are only as powerful as their weakest warrior. Jhe'quith dvenzir - the termination of the frail - strengthens us.
646.context: NodeContext: je-QUITH deh-VEN-zear - The systematic removal of the weak

389.speaker: Player
389.text: That's... incredible. I have no doubt they deserved it.

510.speaker: Lae'zel
510.text: My people have no use for cowards. Every trainee that I slayed was either too weak to withstand the lessons -

8.speaker: Lae'zel
8.text: - or was cocky enough to pick a fight they could never win.

163.speaker: Lae'zel
163.text: They underestimated me. So they paid the price.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: Zorru has fallen. What is our next step?
65.context: NodeContext: A slight bit of tenderness

323.speaker: Player
323.text: You said I've earned your respect. So why are you so rude all the time?
323.context: NodeContext: A slight bit of tenderness

253.speaker: Lae'zel
253.context: NodeContext: A slight bit of tenderness

458.speaker: Lae'zel
458.text: Vlaakith requires everything of her children. Think of how many bruises you've inflicted, how much blood you've drawn in the Undying Queen's name.
458.context: NodeContext: A slight bit of tenderness

263.speaker: Lae'zel
263.text: Vlaakith requires everything of her children. I can't count how many bruises I've inflicted, can't measure how much blood I've drawn in the Undying Queen's name.
263.context: NodeContext: A slight bit of tenderness

99.speaker: Lae'zel
99.text: I know only blood-red and death-black. My mind is silver and my body steel.
99.context: NodeContext: A slight bit of tenderness

306.speaker: Lae'zel
306.text: I am what I must be, say what I must be, to survive every beast I face and every wound I bear.
306.context: NodeContext: A slight bit of tenderness

291.speaker: Player
291.text: Seems it's too late to see to matters at the crèche.

652.speaker: Player
652.text: We've yet to attend to your needs at a githyanki crèche. Is this a bother?

103.speaker: Player
103.text: Ask Lae'zel about the disc from the crèche.

123.speaker: Player
123.text: Ask Lae'zel about the disc from the Underdark.

104.speaker: Player
104.text: Ask Lae'zel about the disc from Moonrise Towers.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: So, how does it feel to be the protector of a githyanki egg?

12.speaker: Player
12.text: I sense something's bothering you. Is this about giving up the egg?

113.speaker: Player
113.text: I wanted to talk to you about the egg. Specifically, about us no longer having it...

212.speaker: Player
212.text: Our egg produced quite the hatchling. I can't help feeling partly responsible...

232.speaker: Player
232.text: Do you think the egg is doing well?

2.speaker: Player
2.text: Are you sure a crèche is our only path to a cure?

663.speaker: Lae'zel
663.text: Entirely. I was as devoted to my studies as I was to my training.

7.speaker: Lae'zel
7.text: Each crèche contains a zaith'isk purification device. So I learned from the writings in the K'liir library.

108.speaker: Lae'zel
108.text: The library was a gift from Vlaakith herself, that we may gain total understanding.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: My own varsh taught us nothing of this purification.

225.speaker: Lae'zel
225.text: Now I have seen you enlightened, I will report your progress to Vlaakith herself, once I ascend.

303.speaker: Player
303.text: That kind of wisdom is very valuable.

25.speaker: Lae'zel
25.text: The planes are ever quaking, and their peoples ever shifting. The githyanki possess an eternity of knowledge...

633.speaker: Lae'zel
633.text: ... yet we still collect more. Infinities upon infinities.

308.speaker: Player
308.text: Books are fallible, as are those who write them.

570.speaker: Lae'zel
570.text: Not books, but slates. Wisdom so profound it is etched into stone. Truth as perfect as the Queen who decreed it.

355.speaker: Lae'zel
355.text: I will not brook your ignorance.

554.speaker: Lae'zel
554.text: Countless scholars roam the Astral Sea and beyond - observing the ways of our lessers, exploring planes so distant, order turns to chaos and cold fires rage.

11.speaker: Lae'zel
11.text: I know what you can barely fathom. That you cannot bear it makes it no less true.

141.speaker: Player
141.text: These dreams linger in my memory. Do you think that strange figure will come back?
141.context: NodeContext: She catches herself almost saying "Even me" and changes to "Even ... well."

90.speaker: Lae'zel
90.context: NodeContext: She catches herself almost saying "Even me" and changes to "Even ... well."

347.speaker: Lae'zel
347.text: I had assumed our parasites served a ghaik Elder. But I believe they serve a greater master still.
347.context: NodeContext: She catches herself almost saying "Even me" and changes to "Even ... well."

403.speaker: Player
403.text: A greater master? Who - or what - could that be?
403.context: NodeContext: She catches herself almost saying "Even me" and changes to "Even ... well."

38.speaker: Lae'zel
38.text: A question that burns in my belly day and night.

593.speaker: Lae'zel
593.text: Elders and collectives abide by their own tenets. It would require a powerful Creed to unite them.

348.speaker: Lae'zel
348.text: And now this voice, this Creed, finds our own ears. If it reaches this plane, it may reach others.

511.speaker: Player
511.text: Elders? Doesn't sound like something I want to encounter.
511.context: NodeContext: She catches herself almost saying "Even me" and changes to "Even ... well."

601.speaker: Lae'zel
601.text: An elder brain. It lives without body, without armour, save the brine pool it inhabits.
601.context: NodeContext: She catches herself almost saying "Even me" and changes to "Even ... well."

281.speaker: Lae'zel
281.text: To split one apart is a githyanki's great pleasure. To die to its mind-blast, a githyanki's dread.
281.context: NodeContext: She catches herself almost saying "Even me" and changes to "Even ... well."

635.speaker: Lae'zel
635.text: Many would nigh lose their minds just to near one. Even... well. Most would, and have.
635.context: NodeContext: She catches herself almost saying "Even me" and changes to "Even ... well."

660.speaker: Player
660.text: The Absolute is this 'master'. I'm sure of it.

583.speaker: Lae'zel
583.text: Perhaps. 'Absolute' may be a mere pseudonym behind which this master hides.

625.speaker: Player
625.text: Fever dreams born of the parasite. They should be ignored.

168.speaker: Lae'zel
168.text: Buffoonery - and you believe it no more than I do.

226.speaker: Lae'zel
226.text: Whatever this voice, whomever this master, it dominates dreams and unites minds.

124.speaker: Player
124.text: A greater master than an elder brain? A ulitharid, perhaps?

350.speaker: Lae'zel
350.text: A ulitharid? A powerful servant, but a servant all the same.

190.speaker: Lae'zel
190.text: Few ghaik break free of an Elder's grasp. None could dominate our dreams or unite our minds alone.

447.speaker: Lae'zel
447.text: They unite under one Creed. And if it reaches our ears on this plane, it may reach others.

532.speaker: Player
532.text: A collective, then - many Elders come together for greater ends.

648.speaker: Lae'zel
648.text: A possibility. Yet it would require a powerful Creed to unite the Elders.

491.speaker: Player
491.text: You said you were going to share your bunk with Wyll.
491.context: NodeContext: Yes, allusive is the right word :) (As in, allegorical)

461.speaker: Player
461.text: You said you were going to share your bunk with Astarion.
461.context: NodeContext: Yes, allusive is the right word :) (As in, allegorical)

379.speaker: Lae'zel
379.text: So I did, and he served his use. Most enthusiastically, I might add.

354.speaker: Lae'zel
354.text: I may even avail myself of his talents again, should he keep his fangs off my flesh.

442.speaker: Lae'zel
442.text: I may even avail myself of his talents again, should I require it.

572.speaker: Player
572.text: You said you were going to share your bunk with Shadowheart.
572.context: NodeContext: Yes, allusive is the right word :) (As in, allegorical)

41.speaker: Lae'zel
41.text: So I did. And she wanted only to talk.

421.speaker: Lae'zel
421.text: You both lack imagination. Eye to eye with bliss, and you choose banality in its stead.

155.speaker: Player
155.text: You said you were going to share your bunk with Gale.
155.context: NodeContext: Yes, allusive is the right word :) (As in, allegorical)

110.speaker: Lae'zel
110.text: So I did. And he wanted only to talk.

493.speaker: Player
493.text: Was the relic really worth killing Shadowheart over?
493.context: NodeContext: Yes, allusive is the right word :) (As in, allegorical)

312.speaker: Lae'zel
312.text: Had Shadowheart produced the relic, she would have lived. She chose deceit over her own life.

496.speaker: Lae'zel
496.text: The object must be returned to my people, by my hands or another's.

505.speaker: Player
505.text: Can I assume we've put our quarrel to rest?
505.context: NodeContext: Yes, allusive is the right word :) (As in, allegorical)

46.speaker: Lae'zel
46.text: I understand there's an aphorism among your kind. One of my cousins at Crèche K'liir uttered it, and I damned near sliced out her tongue for it.
46.context: NodeContext: Yes, allusive is the right word :) (As in, allegorical)

64.speaker: Lae'zel
64.context: NodeContext: Yes, allusive is the right word :) (As in, allegorical)

426.speaker: Lae'zel
426.text: The githyanki teach a different maxim: 'The sheathed blade remains just as sharp.'
426.context: NodeContext: Yes, allusive is the right word :) (As in, allegorical)

566.speaker: Lae'zel
566.text: What do you think of it, Shadowheart?
566.context: NodeContext: Yes, allusive is the right word :) (As in, allegorical)

485.speaker: Player
485.text: I think I take your point. I'll try to stay on your good side.
485.context: NodeContext: Yes, allusive is the right word :) (As in, allegorical)

169.speaker: Lae'zel
169.text: I ask for a certain modicum of respect.
169.context: NodeContext: Yes, allusive is the right word :) (As in, allegorical)

443.speaker: Lae'zel
443.text: The more secrets you keep from me, the less respectful you are.
443.context: NodeContext: Yes, allusive is the right word :) (As in, allegorical)

198.speaker: Lae'zel
198.text: And the less respectful you are, the stronger my urge becomes to unsheathe my allusive blade.
198.context: NodeContext: Yes, allusive is the right word :) (As in, allegorical)

609.speaker: Player
609.text: I need more assurance than an old githyanki metaphor.
609.context: NodeContext: Yes, allusive is the right word :) (As in, allegorical)

377.speaker: Lae'zel
377.text: I will not attack if you give me no reason. Is that assurance enough?

55.speaker: Player
55.text: It's a good maxim. I might have said the same to you.
55.context: NodeContext: Yes, allusive is the right word :) (As in, allegorical)

37.speaker: Lae'zel
37.text: There's much you might have said, but chose not to.
37.context: NodeContext: Yes, allusive is the right word :) (As in, allegorical)

24.speaker: Lae'zel
24.text: We may have reached a truce, but that does not mean my allusive blade will grow dull.
24.context: NodeContext: Yes, allusive is the right word :) (As in, allegorical)

153.speaker: Lae'zel
153.text: And the more secrets you keep, the stronger my urge will be to unsheathe it.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: I'd like a straight answer. Is our quarrel over or not?
89.context: NodeContext: Yes, allusive is the right word :) (As in, allegorical)

638.speaker: Lae'zel
638.context: NodeContext: Yes, allusive is the right word :) (As in, allegorical)

419.speaker: Lae'zel
419.text: But remember this: The more secrets you keep, the stronger my urge to unsheathe my allusive blade.
419.context: NodeContext: Yes, allusive is the right word :) (As in, allegorical)

629.speaker: Lae'zel
629.text: It is over, where I am concerned.

366.speaker: Player
366.text: That's a relief. We won't survive this if we don't stand together.

390.speaker: Lae'zel
390.text: It is through conflict that we strengthen our bonds.

664.speaker: Lae'zel
664.text: Yet I do not recommend Shadowheart seek it again.

174.speaker: Lae'zel
174.text: The next resolution may not end in her favour.

179.speaker: Player
179.text: Can I trust you not to cause more trouble?

623.speaker: Lae'zel
623.text: I will not be bearing the burden of the half-elf's deceit.

92.speaker: Lae'zel
92.text: She was the source of strife; I was the end of it.

610.speaker: Lae'zel
610.text: I suggest you turn your eye of judgement to her.

242.speaker: Player
242.text: I'll simply kill you both if it happens again.

234.speaker: Lae'zel
234.text: Mm - yes, I'm sure you believe that.

175.speaker: Lae'zel
175.text: Reality would not reflect your ego, I'm afraid.

619.speaker: Player
619.text: I find it unbearable that Shadowheart possesses a gith relic.

207.speaker: Lae'zel
207.text: I said we no longer quarreled. I have not said we must trust her.

483.speaker: Lae'zel
483.text: Watch her with keen eyes. One wrong move, and we act.

622.speaker: Player
622.text: I've lingering doubts. Trusting a Sharran disciple goes against everything I know.

224.speaker: Player
224.text: Good. I don't want my loyalties tested any further.

370.speaker: Lae'zel
370.text: Yes - I presume your kind would sooner shelter in darkness than face conflict.

544.speaker: Lae'zel
544.text: A naive approach. Life is conflict. You may resolve it with words, or with might.

591.speaker: Lae'zel
591.text: Otherwise, it festers. It becomes a parasite of its own. Ignore it at your peril.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: You look so... unusual. Githyanki are rare in these parts.

109.speaker: Lae'zel
109.text: As are your sort, I expect. Am I your first?

527.speaker: Lae'zel
527.text: I expect I am your first.

204.speaker: Player
204.text: I'd never heard of your kind until my capture.
204.context: CinematicNodeContext: She looks at you, chin lifted slightly.NodeContext: haughty/ arrogant

371.speaker: Lae'zel
371.text: Chk. I suppose I am as alien to you as you are to me. I know of your kind, but I do not often encounter them.
371.context: CinematicNodeContext: She looks at you, chin lifted slightly.NodeContext: haughty/ arrogant

357.speaker: Lae'zel
357.text: Those diminutive scales of yours look like mistakes.
357.context: CinematicNodeContext: She looks at you, chin lifted slightly.NodeContext: haughty/ arrogant

577.speaker: Player
577.text: Come on now. Are they really that bad?

454.speaker: Lae'zel
454.text: You look out of proportion. An oversized lizard with delusions of grandeur.

315.speaker: Lae'zel
315.text: No matter - I don't intend to keep my eyes trained on you for longer than necessary.

636.speaker: Player
636.text: Better to be scaled than noseless and covered in spots.

643.speaker: Lae'zel
643.text: 'Better' is an opinion. I much prefer githyanki aesthetic to 'undersized wyrm'.

365.speaker: Lae'zel
365.text: That large, fleshy nose of yours looks like a mistake.
365.context: CinematicNodeContext: She looks at you, chin lifted slightly.NodeContext: haughty/ arrogant

237.speaker: Player
237.text: Come on, now. It isn't that large.

262.speaker: Lae'zel
262.text: Like so much of this world and its undisciplined people.

195.speaker: Player
195.text: As if your upturned bat snout is any better.

604.speaker: Lae'zel
604.text: 'Better' is an opinion. But mine is certainly more economical.

526.speaker: Lae'zel
526.text: It was an observation. Not a compliment.

603.speaker: Lae'zel
603.text: No matter. I do not intend to stay long in this place.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: Be silent in the face of her goading.

596.speaker: Lae'zel
596.text: Yes - best to keep quiet, lest any drivel leak from your lips.

429.speaker: Player
429.text: I know of githyanki, but I've never met one.

611.speaker: Lae'zel
611.text: Of course you haven't. They would have cut you from navel to neck.

466.speaker: Lae'zel
466.text: You are no less alien to me than I am to you. I know of your kind, but I do not often encounter them.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: I've crossed paths with githyanki before.

14.speaker: Lae'zel
14.text: And they didn't cut you from navel to neck?

181.speaker: Lae'zel
181.text: I am still getting used to people like you. I know of your kind, but I do not often encounter them.
181.context: NodeContext: She lifts her chin and inspects you.

422.speaker: Player
422.text: I've heard enough about your kind to know they're trouble.

373.speaker: Lae'zel
373.text: Yes. Given the chance, most would cut you from navel to neck.

489.speaker: Lae'zel
489.text: Great is your fortune that I've let you live.

431.speaker: Player
431.text: Do you know much about mind flayers?
431.context: NodeContext: He is recalling facts. Determined. Remembering them all.

509.speaker: Lae'zel
509.text: I understand much beyond your comprehension.

21.speaker: Lae'zel
21.text: More to the point, I know the cure for our condition.

462.speaker: Lae'zel
462.text: It is imperative we locate a crèche. You'd do well to observe more and question less.

396.speaker: Player
396.text: Do you know what happens if we don't find a cure?
396.context: NodeContext: He is recalling facts. Determined. Remembering them all.

624.speaker: Lae'zel
624.text: Yes. In great detail. It starts with a fever and memory loss.

450.speaker: Player
450.text: What might happen should we not be purified?
450.context: NodeContext: He is recalling facts. Determined. Remembering them all.

244.speaker: Lae'zel
244.text: It starts with a fever and memory loss.

143.speaker: Lae'zel
143.text: Then you start to hallucinate. Your hair falls out and you bleed from every orifice.

555.speaker: Lae'zel
555.text: Your bones will change form. Your jaw will split to allow room for four great tentacles.

230.speaker: Lae'zel
230.text: All skin will turn to gore, and be shed to reveal new flesh underneath.

106.speaker: Lae'zel
106.text: Then you have ceased to exist, and a mind flayer is born.

589.speaker: Player
589.text: That sounds awful. How are you so calm?

219.speaker: Lae'zel
219.text: Because I do not intend to let this happen. Not to me, and if you stick with me, not to you.

6.speaker: Lae'zel
6.text: We must find my kind and be rid of the parasite. It's as simple as that.

533.speaker: Lae'zel
533.text: The first symptoms should have long since started, though. That is what puzzles me.

517.speaker: Player
517.text: You're worried we haven't changed? This is good news.

51.speaker: Lae'zel
51.text: Yes. If you give it no further thought. But anomalies lead to surprises.

267.speaker: Lae'zel
267.text: Besides, what hasn't happened may yet come to pass.

476.speaker: Player
476.text: Try to suppress your rising panic.

407.speaker: Lae'zel
407.text: That shiver betrays your fear. Suppress it. It is useless.

661.speaker: Player
661.text: That's not going to happen. We will find a cure.

256.speaker: Lae'zel
256.text: Words forged in steel. May your actions express the same mettle.

599.speaker: Player
599.text: Thinking of that worm inside me... it's driving me mad.
599.context: NodeContext: He is recalling facts. Determined. Remembering them all.

471.speaker: Lae'zel
471.text: We were flayed, beaten, burned, and poisoned in our training.
471.context: NodeContext: He is recalling facts. Determined. Remembering them all.

250.speaker: Lae'zel
250.text: It is our duty to withstand suffering, and our pleasure to conquer it.

552.speaker: Lae'zel
552.text: Come. We must locate a crèche. Observe everything. Assume nothing.

152.speaker: Player
152.text: From which crèche do you hail?

565.speaker: Lae'zel
565.text: I was trained on Crèche K'liir among the Tears of Selûne.

211.speaker: Player
211.text: The truth seeks release. Should you tell Lae'zel about your devotion to Shar?
211.context: InternalNodeContext: Avatar Astarion has the option to tell his companion that he's a vampire spawn.

299.speaker: Narrator
299.text: *Your relationship is in good standing. Surely, Lae'zel will reaffirm her allegiance.*

411.speaker: Narrator
411.text: *Lae'zel is an ally, but not quite a friend. There's no telling how she might respond to the truth.*

587.speaker: Narrator
587.text: *Lae'zel hardly thinks highly of you. The truth could further damage your alliance.*

0.speaker: Player
0.text: It's time you knew: I worship Shar, the Lady of Loss.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: It's time you knew: I worship Shar, the Lady of Loss.

331.speaker: Lae'zel
331.text: The goddess of secrets? How telling.

606.speaker: Lae'zel
606.text: The goddess of secrets? How telling.

486.speaker: Lae'zel
486.text: That you would shine a light into your own shadowed heart? More telling still.

28.speaker: Lae'zel
28.text: A pearl of honesty - an unexpected and iridescent gift from a cleric of Shar.

559.speaker: Lae'zel
559.text: If it was offered in good faith, then I will offer mine in return.

548.speaker: Lae'zel
548.text: You would do well not to squander it; a githyanki's goodwill is even rarer than a Sharran of integrity.

412.text: The goddess of secrets? How telling.

381.speaker: Lae'zel
381.text: The goddess of secrets? How telling.

630.speaker: Lae'zel
630.text: You hide in the Dark Lady's shadows, threading lies and mysteries out of her decaying weave.

249.speaker: Lae'zel
249.text: I can't say what you hoped to gain by lifting your veil, apart from rotting the air with lies yet untold.

77.speaker: Lae'zel
77.text: But I must applaud your honesty, at very least.

441.speaker: Lae'zel
441.text: Now I know to keep a blade at the ready should you slink too close.

380.speaker: Player
380.text: It's time you knew: I worship Shar, the Lady of Loss.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: Tell Lae'zel about the orb in your chest, and how it came to be there.
43.context: InternalNodeContext: Avatar Astarion has the option to tell his companion that he's a vampire spawn.

460.speaker: Lae'zel
460.text: A quest for power and a goddess' retribution - a classic tale of hubris. A folly even the githyanki are known to suffer from.

425.speaker: Lae'zel
425.text: Not that I could relate, of course.

595.speaker: Lae'zel
595.text: My choices seem simple enough. One: Slay you and be done with it. Two: Go my own way. Three: Keep you well-fed with powerful magic.

515.speaker: Lae'zel
515.text: The first two are tempting, I must say - but a good wizard's spells are as valuable to me as my blade is to them.

146.speaker: Lae'zel
146.text: So choice three it is: we will fatten you with the artefacts you require. And when I need your aid, I'll make certain you return the favour.

457.speaker: Lae'zel
457.text: A fair trade by any estimation.

101.speaker: Player
101.text: I'd like to talk about Elminster's visit.
101.context: InternalNodeContext: Avatar Astarion has the option to tell his companion that he's a vampire spawn.

170.speaker: Lae'zel
170.text: Yes, the Sage of Shadowdale. Some of his works have been translated to tir'su.

549.speaker: Lae'zel
549.text: That doesn't mean his every word carries wisdom, however.

227.speaker: Lae'zel
227.text: Near as I can tell, your goddess demands faith - but holds no faith in you.

464.speaker: Lae'zel
464.text: Why else would she demand you sacrifice yourself and perhaps so many others?

423.speaker: Lae'zel
423.text: Does she not think you can destroy the Absolute with your own immense talents? Does she not know the mighty company that you keep?

78.speaker: Lae'zel
78.text: Demanding Vlaakith may be, but she acts for the good of the githyanki people. Mystra is concerned only for herself.

88.speaker: Lae'zel
88.text: Bah - perhaps you'd find forgiveness in a fiery death. But I can't help but wonder why you'd want it at all.

218.speaker: Player
218.text: I'd like to talk about Elminster's visit.
218.context: InternalNodeContext: Avatar Astarion has the option to tell his companion that he's a vampire spawn.

164.speaker: Lae'zel
164.text: My allies do so love to keep simmering secrets. Or explosive, in your case.

545.speaker: Lae'zel
545.text: Hence your bearded visitor. Even the githyanki have heard tell of Elminster, the Sage of Shadowdale, you know. Some of his works have been translated to tir'su.

521.speaker: Player
521.text: Consider sharing the truth with Lae'zel: you are a vampire spawn.
521.context: InternalNodeContext: Avatar Astarion has the option to tell his companion that he's a vampire spawn.

519.speaker: Player
519.text: I'd like to talk about something private.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: My past is a mystery to me. Could the parasite have caused that?

243.speaker: Lae'zel
243.text: Ceremophosis takes all of you - mind, body, soul. An ordinary tadpole would eat at your memories until they were lost to the void.

200.speaker: Lae'zel
200.text: But our tadpoles are far from ordinary. I wonder if another factor's in play.

597.speaker: Player
597.text: I've had these urges. I want to kill. I want blood.

614.speaker: Lae'zel
614.text: Many a good warrior savours the scent of blood in the air. There's no shame in a capricious murder now and again.

264.speaker: Lae'zel
264.text: Too many, though, and you waste energy and dull your weapon.

556.speaker: Lae'zel
556.text: My suggestion: attack with purpose, and savour your kills. And if the urge proves too much, well, I'm sure we can find you a goblin or two to carve up.

432.speaker: Player
432.text: I didn't kill Alfira, no matter what you might think.

73.speaker: Lae'zel
73.text: I'll tell you what I think anyway:

68.speaker: Lae'zel
68.text: I won't miss Alfira. But I won't stand for chaos. Govern your hunger, before it governs you.

334.speaker: Player
334.text: I could've killed you. What if it happens again - and I succeed?
334.context: NodeContext: Said with some degree of regret, but hidden away.

376.speaker: Lae'zel
376.text: I will try to help you resist. But spill a single drop of my blood, and yours will flow in a gusher.

305.speaker: Player
305.text: Behold, for I am the Slayer!
305.context: NodeContext: Said with some degree of regret, but hidden away.

498.speaker: Lae'zel
498.text: A fitting name. But have you become the Slayer - or has a Slayer merely found a host too weak to evict it?

490.speaker: Lae'zel
490.text: I shouldn't need to say it, but - be careful who you take as an ally. Especially when that ally's taken residence inside you.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: Last Light is no more. The shadows are victorious!
59.context: NodeContext: Said with some degree of regret, but hidden away.

318.speaker: Lae'zel
318.text: Yes. And owing to your dubious compulsions, we've lost crucial allies.

31.speaker: Lae'zel
31.text: You are powerful. But not insightful.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: I discovered I'm a Bhaalspawn. The Lord of Murder's blood flows through me.
75.context: NodeContext: Said with some degree of regret, but hidden away.

307.speaker: Lae'zel
307.text: I'm not surprised. You've become death incarnate. Mighty, yes. And altogether unpredictable and intractable.

82.speaker: Lae'zel
82.text: One day, perhaps soon, Bhaal will demand your fealty. You'll either muster the strength to defy him - or you will succumb.

255.speaker: Player
255.text: My bloodlust has faded. I've refused Bhaal's vicious call.
255.context: NodeContext: Said with some degree of regret, but hidden away.

324.speaker: Lae'zel
324.text: You have vanquished the Slayer, as I knew you would. You are strong, you are mighty. You are you.

210.speaker: Player
210.text: I've become the Chosen of Bhaal. I am murder, I am death. I am the Slayer eternal.
210.context: NodeContext: Said with some degree of regret, but hidden away.

329.speaker: Lae'zel
329.text: Lord Bhaal's Chosen. You must think yourself mighty for it.

649.speaker: Lae'zel
649.text: Yet you were already mighty. And you would have been mightier still if you'd defied him and your 'urges'.

580.speaker: Player
580.context: NodeContext: Said with some degree of regret, but hidden away.

472.speaker: Player
472.text: Any chance of sharing our bunks again anytime soon?
472.context: NodeContext: Said with some degree of regret, but hidden away.

66.speaker: Lae'zel
66.text: I'll consider it if I am in need of relief. Until then, I'll enjoy watching you squirm from the anticipation of it.

605.speaker: Lae'zel
605.text: Perhaps, if I am in need of relief. Until then, I'll enjoy watching you squirm from the anticipation of it.

202.speaker: Player
202.text: So - what are your thoughts on polyamory?
202.context: NodeContext: Said with some degree of regret, but hidden away.

129.speaker: Lae'zel
129.text: Would I approve if you coupled with Halsin, you mean.

613.speaker: Player
613.text: Yes. He's made a very tempting offer.

80.speaker: Lae'zel
80.text: Undoubtedly. Arms like tree trunks, chest broad as an ocean.

503.speaker: Lae'zel
503.text: But I have laid my claim. Give yourself to him, and you break our bond.

481.speaker: Player
481.text: Just a hypothetical question, I assure you.

438.speaker: Lae'zel
438.text: 'Hypothetically', were you to give yourself to him, you would be breaking our bond.

530.speaker: Player
530.text: I've decided to pursue a relationship with Minthara. I thought you should know.
530.context: NodeContext: Said with some degree of regret, but hidden away.

132.speaker: Lae'zel
132.text: So you've made a choice. Or maybe you'll pretend Minthara made it for you.

292.speaker: Player
292.text: I've decided to pursue a relationship with Gale. I thought you should know.
292.context: NodeContext: Said with some degree of regret, but hidden away.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: I've decided to pursue a relationship with Wyll. I thought you should know.
54.context: NodeContext: Said with some degree of regret, but hidden away.

569.speaker: Player
569.text: I've decided to pursue a relationship with Karlach. I thought you should know.
569.context: NodeContext: Said with some degree of regret, but hidden away.

492.speaker: Player
492.text: I've decided to pursue a relationship with Astarion. I thought you should know.
492.context: NodeContext: Said with some degree of regret, but hidden away.

361.speaker: Player
361.text: I've decided to pursue a relationship with Shadowheart. I thought you should know.
361.context: NodeContext: Said with some degree of regret, but hidden away.

353.speaker: Player
353.text: It's been some time since our... liaison. Is there any hope for another?
353.context: NodeContext: Said with some degree of regret, but hidden away.

448.speaker: Lae'zel
448.text: Not that I hadn't thought about it. You were a better lay than I'd expected.

257.speaker: Lae'zel
257.text: But I've gone off the idea. We've an elder brain to destroy, and cannot risk unneeded distraction.

276.speaker: Player
276.text: Did you hear? I don't have eyes for Shadowheart, only for you.
276.context: NodeContext: Said with some degree of regret, but hidden away.

191.speaker: Lae'zel
191.text: I though as much. I suppose I should be flattered.

550.speaker: Player
550.text: Did you hear? I don't have eyes for Astarion, only for you.
550.context: NodeContext: Said with some degree of regret, but hidden away.

127.speaker: Player
127.text: Did you hear? I don't have eyes for Karlach, only for you.
127.context: NodeContext: Said with some degree of regret, but hidden away.

102.speaker: Player
102.text: Did you hear? I don't have eyes for Wyll, only for you.
102.context: NodeContext: Said with some degree of regret, but hidden away.

115.speaker: Player
115.text: Did you hear? I don't have eyes for Gale, only for you.
115.context: NodeContext: Said with some degree of regret, but hidden away.

634.speaker: Player
634.text: Is it me, or have you been looking at me differently?
634.context: NodeContext: Said with some degree of regret, but hidden away.

524.speaker: Player
524.context: NodeContext: Said with some degree of regret, but hidden away.

126.speaker: Player
126.text: I'm ending our fling, if one can call it that.
126.context: NodeContext: Said with some degree of regret, but hidden away.

107.speaker: Lae'zel
107.context: NodeContext: Said with some degree of regret, but hidden away.

165.speaker: Lae'zel
165.text: Do as you like. The loss is not so much mine as yours.
165.context: NodeContext: Said with some degree of regret, but hidden away.

223.speaker: Lae'zel
223.text: Of course you have. If I'm in the mood for a lay, I'll know who to call on.

612.speaker: Player
612.text: Have you thought about making use of the tadpole's power?

537.speaker: Lae'zel
537.text: Mark my words, this power would be no blessing, but a curse.

506.speaker: Lae'zel
506.text: You might as well ask me to gouge out my eyes for the promise of sight, or slice off my tongue for the promise of taste.

451.speaker: Lae'zel
451.text: The mere suggestion is an insult.

216.speaker: Lae'zel
216.text: Consume all the ghaik tadpoles you wish. I'm not so craven.
216.context: NodeContext: Starting to 'Perhaps you are right, and changes her mind.

328.speaker: Player
328.text: If we must bear the tadpoles' burdens, we should also avail ourselves of their power.
328.context: NodeContext: Starting to 'Perhaps you are right, and changes her mind.

5.speaker: Lae'zel
5.context: NodeContext: Starting to 'Perhaps you are right, and changes her mind.

563.speaker: Lae'zel
563.context: NodeContext: Starting to 'Perhaps you are right, and changes her mind.

70.speaker: Lae'zel
70.text: When the tadpole has stretched to every pore and slithered through every vein, what am I to do then?

173.speaker: Player
173.text: This cult of the Absolute is dangerous. We should take all the help we can get.

184.speaker: Player
184.text: You want to face an elder brain without every possible advantage? Ha!

546.speaker: Player
546.text: I am a living example of the tadpole's benefits. I've never felt more powerful.

477.speaker: Player
477.text: Depraved or not, if you truly wish to be mighty, you need these new talents.

594.speaker: Player
594.text: Depraved or not, you are no good to your queen dead. You need these talents.

453.speaker: Lae'zel
453.text: The githyanki have long studied ghaik and used what we've learned. The zaith'isk itself was devised from such knowledge.

406.speaker: Lae'zel
406.text: The tadpole is perhaps not just a curse, but a weapon I can twist and mould to my advantage.

480.speaker: Lae'zel
480.text: Very well. I will swallow my disgust and avail myself of the parasite's powers.

138.text: You're wasting your time and mine. The answer is 'no'.

316.speaker: Lae'zel
316.text: You're wasting your time and mine. The answer is 'no'.

319.text: And when the tadpole has stretched to every pore and slithered through every vein, what then?

335.speaker: Lae'zel
335.text: And when the tadpole has stretched to every pore and slithered through every vein, what then?

289.speaker: Lae'zel
289.text: It won't hear my screams, it won't care if I beg. I will be remade in its image.

235.speaker: Lae'zel
235.text: My own might will sustain me. I have no need of this depraved power.

399.speaker: Lae'zel
399.text: My faith in Vlaakith will guide me and my own might will sustain me. I have no need of this depraved power.

621.speaker: Player
621.text: If we must bear the tadpoles' burdens, we should also avail ourselves of their power.

359.speaker: Player
359.text: The Emperor's Astral-Touched Tadpole promises exceptional power.
359.context: NodeContext: geh-LICK - githyanki version of a sigh

229.speaker: Lae'zel
229.text: It also promises to break us beyond repair. This ossified parasite does not make us more, but less.
229.context: NodeContext: geh-LICK - githyanki version of a sigh

247.speaker: Lae'zel
247.text: Do you not feel the cold where once there was heat? The void, where your soul once resided?
247.context: NodeContext: geh-LICK - githyanki version of a sigh

420.speaker: Player
420.text: Connect with Lae'zel's mind. Let her feel the sense of power coursing through you.
420.context: NodeContext: geh-LICK - githyanki version of a sigh

363.text: I can feel them - the might, the vigour, the possibilities...

488.speaker: Lae'zel
488.text: I can feel them - the might, the vigour, the possibilities...

440.speaker: Lae'zel
440.text: The elder brain could be the harbinger of the Grand Design and the doom of the githyanki.

268.speaker: Player
268.text: It's not like that, Lae'zel. Accept the Astral-Touched Tadpole's power. You'll be unstoppable.
268.context: NodeContext: geh-LICK - githyanki version of a sigh

83.speaker: Player
83.text: It's not like that, Lae'zel. Accept the Astral-Touched Tadpole's power. You'll be unstoppable.
83.context: NodeContext: geh-LICK - githyanki version of a sigh

465.speaker: Lae'zel
465.text: G'lyck. The elder brain - it could be the harbinger of the Grand Design and the doom of the githyanki.
465.context: NodeContext: geh-LICK - githyanki version of a sigh

449.speaker: Lae'zel
449.text: G'lyck. The elder brain - it could be the harbinger of the Grand Design and the doom of the githyanki.
449.context: NodeContext: geh-LICK - githyanki version of a sigh

497.speaker: Lae'zel
497.text: The endtime of the sixteen planes will be upon us. And the Astral would be the first to fall.

154.speaker: Lae'zel
154.text: Very well. I will accept what this damnable ghaik-rock has to offer.

310.text: No. No. I will not become more ghaik than the damned parasite in my skull has already made me.

632.speaker: Lae'zel
632.text: No. No. I will not become more ghaik than the damned parasite in my skull has already made me.

375.speaker: Lae'zel
375.text: You may have bowed to the Emperor for the sake of this power. I will not be so weak.

665.speaker: Player
665.text: It's not like that, Lae'zel. Accept the Astral-Touched Tadpole's power. You'll be unstoppable.

270.speaker: Player
270.text: It's fine. You don't need to use it.

473.speaker: Lae'zel
473.text: There will be ice where once there was fire. There will be a void where our souls once resided.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: I'd like you to join me.

653.speaker: Lae'zel
653.text: You've no room. Dismiss your weakest warrior.

23.speaker: Lae'zel
23.text: You've no room. Dismiss your weakest warrior.

434.speaker: Player
434.text: You're right. It's better if you stay at my side.

495.speaker: Lae'zel
495.text: Then that's where I will stay.

631.speaker: Player
631.text: I'm certain. I'll find you in camp when I need you.

395.speaker: Player
395.text: I'm certain. I'll come for you when I need you.

167.speaker: Lae'zel
167.text: Very well. I'll keep watch until you call on me.

584.speaker: Lae'zel
584.text: Are you sure that's the best course of action?

602.speaker: Player
602.text: Actually, I'd rather you stay in my party.

501.speaker: Lae'zel
501.text: Well chosen. What good is a warrior who's exiled from battle?

578.speaker: Player
578.text: Go to camp. I'll fetch you when the time is right.

30.speaker: Lae'zel
30.text: Confirmed. Until then, I remain at the ready.

618.speaker: Player
618.text: Stay in camp. I'll fetch you when the time is right.

352.speaker: Lae'zel
352.text: Chk. You believe you can survive without me?

96.speaker: Player
96.text: On second thought, you should stay with me.

400.speaker: Player
400.text: Yes - go to camp. I can find you there.

433.speaker: Lae'zel
433.text: As you say. Do not keep me waiting.

147.speaker: Lae'zel
147.text: We travel west. We may yet witness signs of a crèche, if you are not so busy ignoring me.

203.speaker: Lae'zel
203.text: We travel west. We may yet witness signs of a crèche, if you are not so busy ignoring me.

439.speaker: Lae'zel
439.text: We travel west. We may yet witness signs of a crèche, if you are not so busy ignoring me.

418.speaker: Lae'zel
418.text: I had but one request: to speak to Zorru. And you have made a mockery of it.
